Package model

Class InvaderCluster

java.lang.Object
model.Entity
model.InvaderCluster
public class InvaderCluster extends Entity
InvaderCluster contains Invaders to move and manage. The invader cluster manages how invaders should move in a group. It also manages when to change direction, where to spawn the invaders, and when they reach the end. The InvaderCluster has a collider that is automatically changes depending on the invaders contained inside this entity. There is no sprite inside of the InvaderCluster.

  • Constructor Details

    • InvaderCluster

      public InvaderCluster(Game game, float x, float y)
      Construct invader cluster at a given x and y position. The width and height are automatically determined by the invaders spawned.
      Parameters:
      game - to instantiate to
      x - absolute x to spawn at
      y - absolute y to spawn at

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      Description copied from class: Entity
      Should be overriden to add functionality for game tick updates. If instantiated, the game will be able to call this method on every game update. Will not be called as soon as it is deleted with .delete().
      Overrides:
      update in class Entity

    • calculateHitBox

      public void calculateHitBox()
      Calculates the new hitbox/collider size depending on how big it needs to be to **contain** all the invaders. Contain here means that the invaders will be fully encompassed inside of the InvaderCluser collider, such that the all verticies of all invader colliders are inside the area of the InvaderCluser collider.

    • spawnAllInvaders

      public void spawnAllInvaders(float x, float y, float width, float height, int xCount, int yCount)
      Spawn all invaders at the given positions and size. The invaders will have their own size. This method simply places the invaders within a bounding region given (x y width height) while making sure to contain all invaders inside of the region.
      Parameters:
      x - absolute x to spawn at (centered)
      y - absolute y to spawn at (centered)
      width - to scale collider of InvaderCluster to
      height - to scale collider of InvaderCluster to
      xCount - how many invaders to place left to right
      yCount - how many invaders to place up to down

    • spawnBoss

      public void spawnBoss(float x, float y, float width, float height, int maxHp)
      Spawns a boss invader at the specified location. The height given will determine the size of this invader. A maxHp will also be passed to determine the amount of health this invader will have.
      Parameters:
      game - to instantiate to
      x - absolute x to spawn at (centered)
      y - absolute y to spawn at (centered)
      width - to scale collider and sprite to
      height - to scale collider and sprite to
      maxHp - of the spawned boss

    • spawnInvader

      public Invader spawnInvader(float x, float y, float width, float height, InvaderType invaderType, javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Spawn an invader at a given position and size. The size will determine the size of the invader. The invader type and color will determine the sprite and sprite color of the invader.
      Parameters:
      game - to instantiate to
      x - absolute x to spawn at (centered)
      y - absolute y to spawn at (centered)
      width - to scale collider and sprite of Invader to
      height - to scale collider and sprite of Invader to
      invaderType - to represent the invader with (for sprites)
      color - to paint the sprite to
      Returns:
      a new invader which has been instantiated

    • setDifficulty

      public void setDifficulty(float amount)
      Sets the difficulty of the InvaderCluster. This applies a new speed and bullet count value to the InvaderCluster, thus affecting how the Invaders behave.
      Parameters:
      amount - new difficulty multiplier to set to.

    • updateClusterSpeed

      public void updateClusterSpeed()
      Updates invader cluster speeds by determining a new speed for the invader cluster based on the speed multipliers and the current invader count.
